Serbian Factory – industrial zone near a mid-sized city in northern Serbia (near Novi Sad)
Remote / Home Office (hybrid roles across Italy, Serbia and EU branches)

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures the AI agent routes reads/writes to the correct backend system and doesn’t create parallel, inconsistent data stores.
Prevents anonymous/public users from accessing internal systems or data via the chatbot or APIs.
Prevents a public-facing chatbot from leaking internal data such as employees, customers, projects or time logs.
rules.compact_rule:
IF chatbot.context == 'public' THEN
  FORBID responses containing:
    - precise employee profiles (beyond generic public roles if explicitly allowed),
    - internal customer/CRM details,
    - internal project, workload, or time tracking data,
    - salary or HR-internal information,
    - non-public wiki content;
  USE only explicitly whitelisted, public-safe data sources.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines that all internal chatbot/API calls must be made in the context of a specific employee identity with known attributes for access control.
Formalises role-based access control using system roles so the AI agent can check permissions before performing actions.
Restricts what any authenticated employee can see from the employee registry via the chatbot, protecting confidential HR data.
Allows managers and HR to see full employee profiles including confidential fields, reflecting HR policies.
Ensures salary data remains confidential and that the chatbot correctly signals permission denials instead of leaking or pretending not to know.
Prevents the wiki from being misused as a store for very sensitive personal data such as salaries.
Requires the AI agent to use the correct outcome code when a request is blocked for security reasons, enabling UI and logging to correctly detect access violations.
Defines who may create and update employee records, particularly sensitive fields such as salary, and how the AI agent should constrain write operations.
Keeps the skills & wills data model consistent so downstream search and matching work correctly.
Clarifies CRM data ownership so the AI agent doesn’t let unauthorised users create or alter customer master data.
rules.compact_rule:
CRM_WRITE_RULES:
  IF action IN {'create_customer','update_customer_master','change_deal_phase'} THEN
    REQUIRE requester.system_roles ∩ {'SalesUser','CustomerService','SalesManager','ITAdmin'} ≠ ∅;
  ALL other roles: READ-ONLY access via chatbot, outcome='denied_security' for write attempts.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents non-sales users or shadow processes from creating untracked customers outside CRM, ensuring one source of truth.
Defines who can modify project definitions, teams, and workload allocations in the project registry.
rules.compact_rule:
PROJECT_REGISTRY_WRITE_RULES:
  IF action IN {'create_project','update_project_status','modify_project_team','set_workload_timeslice'} THEN
    REQUIRE requester.system_roles ∩ {'ProjectManager','SalesUser','DepartmentLead','ITAdmin'} ≠ ∅;
  Other users: READ-ONLY unless explicitly delegated; unauthorised writes → outcome='denied_security'.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Enforces time-entry edit rules, especially around status transitions and who may edit or submit on behalf of whom.
rules.compact_rule:
TIME_ENTRY_RULES:
  - EmployeeSelf MAY create/update/delete time_entries WHERE status=='draft' AND employee_id==requester.employee_id.
  - EmployeeSelf MAY change status draft→submitted for own entries only.
  - ProjectLead MAY create draft entries FOR team_members but MAY NOT submit them; submission is by EmployeeSelf only.
  - Only roles in {'TimeApprover','Manager','Operations','ITAdmin'} MAY change status submitted→approved or approved→invoiced.
  - Once status IN {'approved','invoiced'} THEN EmployeeSelf CANNOT modify; corrections REQUIRE authorised void+correcting_entry process.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Protects the integrity of invoiced time entries, which are considered financially final.
Constrains how much employee detail (especially skills & wills) is exposed to peers, aligning with the "selected information depending on context" statement.
Ensures all registry-changing actions by the AI agent remain auditable and attributable to a human or controlled service identity.
Clarifies that even remote/hybrid users and branch offices must go through central systems and controls, preventing local bypasses.
